title: A Case Against 6 Democrats Lacked Urgency. Then Came a Swift Bid for an Indictment.
partialText: Prosecutors have been repeatedly caught between the president’s insistence that they undertake weak or baseless cases and the necessity of having to go to court.

title: Democrats Plan to Counter Trump’s State of the Union Speech With Rally
partialText: The House Democratic leader has asked rank-and-file members to sit quietly at the speech or skip it altogether, wary of creating a distraction.

title: Colbert Says CBS Barred Interview With Democrat, and Search Teams Scramble After Lake Tahoe Avalanche
partialText: Plus, Brad Pitt vs. Tom Cruise?

title: Republicans, Braced for Losses, Push More Voting Restrictions in Congress
partialText: Legislation that would require proof of citizenship to register to vote was only the beginning as the G.O.P. presses to sharply limit voting in line with President Trump’s false claims of widespread fraud.

title: An Architect of Virginia’s Redistricting Will Run for a New Seat Himself
partialText: Dan Helmer, a Democratic state lawmaker, played a key role in putting redrawn congressional maps before state voters.

title: Colorado Democrats Push to Rip Up 2028 House Map for an Extra Edge
partialText: A proposed ballot measure to give Democrats more seats for the 2028 and 2030 elections signals that the nation’s gerrymandering fight is likely to persist for years.

title: F.D.A. Reverses Decision and Agrees to Review Moderna’s Flu Vaccine
partialText: Moderna said it had held further discussions with regulators and announced that the agency would accept the company’s application for approval of its flu vaccine that uses mRNA technology.

title: What to Know About mRNA Vaccines
partialText: We asked experts about how the technology works, its safety and its potential in medicine.

title: Russia’s Exile From World Sports Will End Next Month at Paralympics
partialText: Six Russian athletes and four Belarusians will be allowed to represent their nations, officials said. The decision could pave the way for a Russian team to compete at the 2028 Summer Games in Los Angeles.

title: Billy Preston’s Music Was ‘Pure Joy.’ But His Life Ended in Tragedy.
partialText: The Beatles’ beloved collaborator died at 59 in 2006. A new documentary, “That’s the Way God Planned It,” explores what he long kept hidden.

title: ‘Billy Preston’ Review: A Unique and Tortured Talent
partialText: The Beatles, the Stones and Clapton shared the stage with him. He made solo hits, too. A documentary by Paris Barclay explores his success and his difficult life.

title: As Trump Obliterates Climate Efforts, States Try to Fill the Gap
partialText: Across the country, Democratic-led states are accelerating their initiatives to cut greenhouse gas emissions. Their role just became much more important.

title: E.P.A. Faces First Lawsuit Over Its Killing of Major Climate Rule
partialText: Environmental and health groups sued the E.P.A. over its elimination of the endangerment finding. The matter is likely to end up before the Supreme Court.

title: The Behind the Scenes Search for Compromise on Territory in Ukraine Talks
partialText: The latest round of talks ended with no indication of progress, but negotiators are bargaining over who will control land in eastern Ukraine if they reach a settlement.

title: Talks on Russia-Ukraine War Enter 2nd Day in Geneva
partialText: The discussions in Geneva were expected to focus on territorial issues, a major sticking point, but the short duration suggests major progress was not made.

title: Viral Videos Helped Mamdani Win. Can They Help Him Govern?
partialText: Mayor Zohran Mamdani, who won over voters with his approach to social media, is using the same strategy to try to connect City Hall to all New Yorkers.

title: A Police Parking Lot in East Harlem Will Become Affordable Housing
partialText: The project is the latest example of a push by New York City to build homes on land it owns. The building will be 100 percent affordable, officials say.

title: Here’s the latest.
partialText: The avalanche struck a guided backcountry skiing group near Truckee, Calif., near the end of a multiday trip, officials said. Six skiers have been rescued.

title: How Jesse Jackson Took King’s Civil Rights Movement to Company Doorsteps
partialText: Mr. Jackson was critical to Martin Luther King Jr.’s quest to transform a fight for equality in the South to a national movement for economic and social justice.

title: How a Stray Quote of Jesse Jackson’s Led to a Rupture Between Black and Jewish Voters
partialText: The candidate’s reference to New York as “Hymietown” helped tank his 1984 presidential campaign and eroded a longstanding alliance.

title: White House Shrugs Off Lutnick’s Epstein Ties
partialText: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has acknowledged traveling to Jeffrey Epstein’s island and meeting him on another occasion.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI Gets $3 Billion Investment From Saudi-Backed A.I. Firm
partialText: Humain, which was created by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman last year, said it made the investment just before xAI was acquired by SpaceX, Mr. Musk’s rocket company.

title: Power Shift in Syria Upends an Archipelago for ISIS Prisoners
partialText: America’s Kurdish allies oversaw two dozen sites holding thousands of members of the terrorist group and their families. Their withdrawal has left the system in chaos.

title: At These Gaza Schools, ‘Peace Building’ Is Part of the Curriculum
partialText: A fast-growing network of private schools, the brainchild of a North Carolina neurosurgeon, is teaching 9,000 war orphans and other needy Palestinian youngsters.

title: A New Concern About Weight Loss Drugs: What if They Work Too Well?
partialText: Some patients in a clinical trial of one new drug lost so much weight that they became concerned and dropped out.

title: A Downtown Vibe Comes to Broadway This Spring
partialText: Without the usual flood of new musicals, the playwrights of works like “Becky Shaw,” “Dog Day Afternoon” and “Giant” are getting a chance to shine.

title: ‘Brokeback Mountain,’ ‘Black Swan’ and 14 More Plays and Musicals to See This Spring
partialText: Across the country, a flurry of theater productions, including “Black Swan” and “The Lunchbox,” are mining the movies for material.

title: What to See in NYC This Spring: Broadway Shows, Concerts and More
partialText: Onstage, “Cats: The Jellicle Ball” and Adrien Brody in “The Fear of 13.” Plus: Cardi B goes on tour, Lise Davidsen takes on Isolde at the Met, 100 years of Martha Graham and more.

title: Democrats Win in Texas With Candidates Like Taylor Rehmet
partialText: A shock Democratic victory in a Texas special election shows what the party needs to do to win more there — and many other places, too.

title: The A.I. Disruption Has Arrived, and It Sure Is Fun
partialText: We’re entering a new renaissance of software development. We should all be excited, despite the uncertainties that lie ahead.

title: Remembering Jesse Jackson
partialText: We look back at the life and legacy of an American who helped shape our politics and our culture.

title: Stephen Colbert Finds a Place to File CBS’s Surprise Statement
partialText: “I don’t even know what to do with this,” Colbert said about the network’s news release on a scrapped interview with a Democratic politician, before putting the paper in a dog waste bag.

title: A Road Trip from Kandahar to Kabul on Highway 1 in Afghanistan
partialText: Life and business are back along a road once defined by war damage. But even with improved security, Afghans are desperate for jobs and development.

title: California Wealth Tax Opponents Intensify Efforts Before Bernie Sanders Visit
partialText: The opponents’ latest moves include online ads tied to Gov. Gavin Newsom, a crypto-related push to raise money and competing ballot measures.

title: Methane Hunters Track Swamp Gas That Is Driving Climate Warming
partialText: Methane emissions from wetlands are rising faster than those from industrial sources, prompting concerns about a climate feedback loop.

title: Uber Taking Steps to Expand Number of EV Chargers Near Its Drivers
partialText: The company said it would encourage companies that operated chargers to install them in neighborhoods where its drivers lived and work.
